subject: Nutrition
title: Nutrigenomics
description: A micro-lesson that makes Nutrigenomics usable.

hook.text: Your genes decide whether coffee protects your heart or puts it at risk. Nutrigenomics explains why.

buildup.text: Nutrigenomics studies how genetic variations affect the body's response to specific nutrients.

discovery.text: People with slow CYP1A2 variants metabolize caffeine poorlyâ€”for them, coffee raises heart attack risk.

twist.text: Consumer DNA diet tests oversimplify the science. Most genetic nutrition effects are tiny and complex.

climax.text: True nutrigenomics will guide medical therapy, but consumer products are decades ahead of real evidence.

punchline.text: Your DNA shapes your ideal diet. We can't fully read it yet.

quiz.question: What does nutrigenomics study?
options: How genetic variations affect nutrient response
